results.title: Nuclear physics
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Shows step-by-step, how an interest in cathode rays led scientists to discover X-rays, then alpha, beta and gamma radiation, and finally explore the conversion of matter into energy. Vivid computer animation clarifies concepts such as nuclear fission and fusion, shows how a nuclear reactor works and the difficulties in the disposal of radioactive wastes. There six ten minute episodes are: 1. “The Discovery of radioactivity” 2. “Properties of Becquerel rays” 3. “Natural transmutations” 4. “Energy from the nucleus” 5. “Electrical energy from fission” 6. “Nuclear by-products.”

results.title: Structure of the atom
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
These programs explore the history and development of the model of the atom, from the hypothesis of early Greek philosophers to the wave-mechanical model of modern atomic physicists. Experiments by pioneer atomic scientists such as Bohr, Faraday, de Broglie and Rutherford are recreated through animation and their implications are discussed. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Earliest models” 2. “Smaller than smallest” 3. “The Rutherford Model” 4. “The Bohr Model” 5. “Spectra” 6.”The Wave-mechanic Model.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario

results.title: Wave-partical duality
results.creator_credit: David Chamberlain, Ontario Educational Communications Authority and Television Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Traces the development of the various theories advanced to explain the behaviour of light, from the concepts of the ancient Greeks to current proven models. The contributions of Isaac Newtown, Christian Huygens, Thomas Young, Jean Foucault, Albert Einstein and others are outlined as are the reasons for the gradual acceptance of both particle and wave models and their eventual combination. The six 10 minute episodes are: 1. “The Particle model” 2. “The Wave model” 3. “The Electromagnetic model” 4. “The Quantum idea” 5. “Photons” 6. “Matter waves.”

results.title: The Nature of colour: parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Concepts in science: physics”.
Shows the nature of white light by experiments involving the dispersion and re-combination of colours of the spectrum. Illustrates the nature of colour by demonstrations showing the reflection, transmission and absorption of colour.

results.title: Risk factors
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, National Heart Foundation of Australia, Suatu Film Management and Mediacast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help yourself to health”.
Focuses on the main risk factors in coronary heart disease: prolonged high blood pressure, smoking, excessive fat in diet leading to elevated blood cholesterol levels.

results.title: The Heart
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, National Heart Foundation of Australia, Suatu Film Management and Mediacast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help yourself to health”.
The human heart is a remarkable pump, averaging 72 beats a minute, pumping 7,000 litres of blood every day. Medical specialists explain the anatomy and physiology of the heart, the roles played by its valves and chambers as well as the electrical system which regulates the contraction of the heart muscle.

results.title: Media intrusion into grief
results.creator_credit: Mark Bayly and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
Peter Couchman compares a discussion with a group of people from all walks of life, about how “The Media” conduct themselves in reporting death and an individuals grief. Do they intrude where they are not wanted? Are they compassionate or just greedy for a sensational story?

results.title: Schizophrenia

Episode of Series “Couchman over Australia”.
